text:
A high alert has been sounded in Odisha after four men, presenting themselves as Iraqi nationals, disappeared when asked to produce identity proof at a hotel here on Monday night, with the police suspecting them to be terrorists.

The four men, with an estimated height of 6.5 feet and speaking in Hindi or English, came to the hotel in a car with a Delhi registration number which turned out to be fake, police said.

“The four who fled the hotel before the police reached there could be terrorists ... The four suspected terrorists had claimed to be natives of Iraq,” said Director-General of Police K.B. Singh.

Siba Narayan Mohapatra, the hotel manager who interacted with one of the four men, said “While one of them came to the hotel reception desk, three others were inside the car parked outside. The CCTV has captured the picture of one suspected terrorist and the vehicle used by them.”

Commissioner of Police R.P. Sharma said the four persons wanted two rooms at the Hotel Arya Mahal.

“In the wake of the incident, the security for the Chief Minister’s convoy has been beefed up. We have heightened security and frisking,” Mr. Sharma said. A Special Task Force led by IG Arun Bothra of the Crime Branch has started investigation and launched an operation to trace them. — PTI

They fled a hotel after being asked to produce proof of identity
title: High alert as four Iraqi nationals go missing in Odisha
